channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.description:
Hello there!

I hope you spent both the International Workers' Day and Star Wars Day well, and you are ready for the challenges of the new week!

Last week I included a call to support Yanick via GitTip that resulted a few people giving him money, and we also talked about it. As PJF told me, one can set up a team-account in GitTip so people can give tips to a project and then the members of the project can divide the money. So I set up a GitTip account for the Perl Weekly and it already received some gifts. We don't expect to be super-rich from this (at least not in the next few weeks ;), but it would be awesome to get presents from hundreds, or even thousands of our readers. Just 1 cent! Think about it!

The other idea that was suggested by Yanick was to include a new section called 'GitTip Profile of the week'. I find this a good idea as it will give us an opportunity to introduce an open source Perl contributor a week without running lengthy interviews :). It will also give you an opportunity to give a small weekly present to these people. I am going to look at the people listed in the Perl community on GitTip, and the mashup created by Neil Bowers called CPAN Tip.

Enjoy!
item.dc:subject: list of tags?

item.title: Neil Bowers
item.description: Neil has been working tirelessly to make CPAN a better place. He advocates the adoption of CPAN modules, he created the CPAN Tip mashup, and he is working on the CPAN authors' dashboard. I have interviewed him a while ago.

item.title: Simple JSON and Mongo speed test between Perl, Ruby and Python
item.description: The result: Perl is much faster. - Reactions on Reddit.

item.title: New release of Perl DBD::ODBC with support for MS SQL Server Query Notification
Deprecating experience level and preset value in Config::Model
UTF-8 output from Perl and C programs in cmd.exe on Windows 8
item.description: With a follow-up UTF-8 output from Perl in cmd.exe: Layers of goodness.

item.title: Segfault Fixing for Dummies
item.description: Answering a couple of questions such as 'How to print debug messages in XS?' and 'How to validate memory accesses of a C program on Windows?'

item.title: The next Test::More might break fragile test modules
Learning the Perl Debugger - lesson 5
item.description: Setting breakpoints using (b). Listing the breakpoints using (L). Clearing them using (B). Setting conditional breakpoints.

item.title: Detecting JSON/YAML/Perl/CSV/TSV/LTSV
item.description: Steven Haryanto brings up an interesting problem. Give a short string, how can you cheaply(!) detect if it is any of the 'standard' or 'approved' formats?

item.title: Major Dancer 2 release: 0.140000
item.description: Mostly the results of the recent Dancer 2 hackathon.

item.title: All about Dancer â€“ interview of Sawyer X part 2
Introducing CPAN::Releases::Latest
item.description: As Neil Bowers is working on the CPAN author's dashboard he is putting the pieces together. This module allows you to iterate over all the recent releases limited by age.

item.title: News from the MetaCPAN developers
item.description: If you'd like to follow the changes in MetaCPAN, now there is a page for this with an RSS feed.

item.title: What's new on CPAN - April 2014
item.description: The monthly report about new stuff on CPAN.

item.title: European Perl Tour 2014, getting real
item.description: brian d foy and Sawyer X are planning to take the train around Europe. Stop-by interesting places and talk to the local Perl Mongers. If you are interested to having them in your city, check out the article and get in touch with them.

item.title: Devel::Cover grant report March 2014
item.description: After several months break Paul Johnson is back in the saddle and started to work on Devel::Cover again. Including some plans to update cpancover.com.

item.title: Call for Grant Proposals (May round)
item.description: The new, bi-monthly opening for grant requests by The Perl Foundation.

item.title: Outreach Program for Women Internship Begins in May
Supplies talk and sundry
item.description: The Perl 6 weekly update.

item.title: Programming Languages and RailsGirls.tw
item.description: The English transcript(?) of the talk Audrey Tang gave at TEDxTaipei.

item.title: GitTip and the Perl Community
item.description: In a nutshell, I think if all the people who benefit from Perl contributed back to the community, the Perl ecosystem could do a lot more. So if you cannot contribute time, maybe you can contribute some money. GitTip is an easy way to do so.

item.title: Training in London
item.description: This year Dave Cross will run his regular courses in November.

item.title: The Hash-bang line, or how to make a Perl scripts executable on Linux
item.description: Do you know what is the #!/usr/bin/perl at the beginning of Perl scripts? What about #!/usr/bin/env perl ?

item.title: Adding news feed to MetaCPAN
item.description: In this article you'll find a small introduction to how to contribute to MetaCPAN via the naive way the news feed was added.

item.title: Open West
item.description: 8-10 May, 2014, Orem, UT, USA and it has a Perl Track
